Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Protection Division's decision rejecting the applicant's refugee claim was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution due to political activities if returned to Cameroon. Tribunal deemed him not credible.
Court_Ruling: Court allowed judicial review, remanding case for reconsideration by a new panel
Defendant_Behavior: Refugee Protection Division rejected the applicant's claim based on credibility concerns
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution due to political activities in Cameroon
Review_Standard: Reasonableness, requiring justification, transparency, and intelligibility
Credibility_Assessment: Tribunal found inconsistencies (e.g., prison name, medical certificate); court found these peripheral
Evidence_Used: Medical certificate, testimony regarding imprisonment, political activities
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act relating to refugee protection and judicial review
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution upon return to Cameroon due to political opinion
Evidence_Assessed: Inconsistencies in applicant's account regarding prison name and medical documentation
Relief_Sought: Recognition as a refugee, protection from removal
Governing_Rule: Standard of review for credibility assessments is reasonableness
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Perceived inconsistencies deemed not essential to the core claim
Outcome: Decision set aside, matter referred back for redetermination by a different panel
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in Cameroon due to political involvement
Cause_Description: Applicant feared persecution due to political activities if returned to Cameroon
Evidence_Handling: Tribunal focused on minor inconsistencies; court found handling inadequate given their peripheral nature
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; issue was unreasonableness in application of law
Evidence_Issues: Discrepancies in details such as prison name and authenticity of medical certificate
Evidence_Assessment: Court found that the tribunal failed to properly assess materiality of alleged inconsistencies
Decision_Rationale: The decision lacked sufficient justification and intelligibility regarding credibility findings
Evidentiary_Issues: Minor inconsistencies not central to the claim were overemphasized
